TopicTitle: Looking for a part lister mod!!

Articles.Content: Hiya, I used to have a mod that listed all the parts in a build in the vab or sph and allowed you to delete individual parts and remove symmetry I think. Can't seem to find it anymore?? Anyone got any ideas??

I use SimplePartOrganizer, and Editor extensions for symmetry options. I tried part catalog but it was just too much for me.

SPO: http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220245-simple-part-organizer-version-1-2-1

EE: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/38768-0-24-Editor-Extensions-v1-3-19-Jul-2014-(EdTools-Editor-Tools-replacement)
I would have to be a proponent of Part Catalog, as it does everything I need very efficiently, and even allows me to utilize my mouse scroll wheel when browsing the parts in the VAB/SPH

These are all great programs but I was unclear, I was looking for a mod that allows you to see all the parts in a built ship in VAB and remove specific parts, for example if you have strutted a spaceplane but need to remove some hidden struts?!?!

I don't think it can remove parts but TAC Part Lister gives you a nice list of the parts used in your vessel:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/31760-0-23-0-23-5-TAC-Part-Lister-v1-2-22Dec

KSP Mod Admin 1.4 - if my memory doesn't betray me here - also has a nice function where you can look up missing parts from vessels that would not load because of a missing mod. Not what you're looking for, but since it had helped me a few times I thought I might just add it here:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/26031
Thank you for the suggestions, however stripsymmetry doesn't seem to work and TAC part lister just shows a blank window and lots of red in the debug window

I would have to be a proponent of Part Catalog, as it does everything I need very efficiently, and even allows me to utilize my mouse scroll wheel when browsing the parts in the VAB/SPH

Your modlist is awesome btw

Thank you for the suggestions, however stripsymmetry doesn't seem to work and TAC part lister just shows a blank window and lots of red in the debug window

StripSymmetry totally works. It gives you a window of every part currently attached to the vessel in the editor and lets you remove symmetry flags from any of them. By your description, it is *exactly* the mod which you used before.

I prefer PartWizard but I haven't checked yet to see if it works for 0.24.2

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80124-0-23-5-Part-Wizard-(1-1-0)-6-Jun-2014

Your modlist is awesome btw

Thank you!

I prefer PartWizard but I haven't checked yet to see if it works for 0.24.2

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80124-0-23-5-Part-Wizard-(1-1-0)-6-Jun-2014

THAT'S THE ONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Cheers sirkut hopefully it works in 0.24.2

StripSymmetry totally works. It gives you a window of every part currently attached to the vessel in the editor and lets you remove symmetry flags from any of them. By your description, it is *exactly* the mod which you used before.

Not really at all, as in my description I was looking for a mod that allows you to delete individual parts. Which stripsymmetry is incapable of doing even if it worked
